Parameters: Object: The main item for the details page.

setImageScaleUpAllowed(boolean).Description: Allows or disallows scaling up of images. Images will always be scaled down if necessary. Must be called on UI thread after row is bound to view.

isImageScaleUpAllowed().Description: Returns true if the image may be scaled up; false otherwise.

getActionForKeyCode(int).Description: Returns the Action associated with the given keycode, or null if no associated action exists.

Returns: The overview's image drawable, or null if no drawable has been assigned.
getImageDrawable().Description: Returns the image drawable of this details overview.

setItem(java.lang.Object).Description: Sets the main item for the details page. Must be called on UI thread after row is bound to view.

Returns: An unmodifiable view of the list of Actions.
getActions().Description: Use @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#DetailsOverviewRow#setActionsAdapter_E@ and @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#DetailsOverviewRow#getActionsAdapter_E@ Returns a read-only view of the list of Actions of this details overview. It will throw ClassCastException if current actions adapter is not @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ArrayObjectAdapter_E@. Must be called on UI thread.

getItem().Description: Returns the main item for the details page.

ClassDesc: An overview @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Row_E@ for a details fragment. This row consists of an image, a description view, and optionally a series of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Action_E@s that can be taken for the item. @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#DetailsOverviewRow#setActionsAdapter_E@ to set actions on the overview row. @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#SparseArrayObjectAdapter_E@ is recommended for easily updating actions while maintaining the order. The application can add or remove actions on the UI thread after the row is bound to a view. @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#DetailsOverviewRow#setItem_E@ on UI thread and the view will be updated. @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#DetailsOverviewRow#setImageBitmap_E@ or @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#DetailsOverviewRow#setImageDrawable_E@ on the UI thread, and the view will be updated.
